TopicTitle: How will the 64bit version be released?

Articles.Content:
Some simple question about the new 64 bit release on steam...

As you can see at this page http://steamdb.info/app/220200/depots/ there are 4 version of KSP now, but the 32 bit one has a lot of info (http://steamdb.info/depot/220201/) and it is a 1.52 GB install, the 64 bit seems to be a dev version with no info about the files, and seems to be "incomplete" (753.95 MB), so how will the it be released? As a stand alone installation, as an optional patch or will they merge it with the 32 bit one?

How can i upgrade KSP? Will it be automatically upgraded to 0.24 @ 64 bit, or will it still be @ 32 bit?

And if it will still be 32 bit, how can I upgrade to the 64bit one?

Will there be a new game on my steam library, kerbal 64 bit, avaiable to install? Or maybe the installation process will ask us if we want it in 32 or 64 bit?

In other word... to have the 64 bit version can i just let steam upgrade it automatically, or do I have to unistall it and reinstall the 64bit one? Can i have at the same time the 32 and 64 bit?
Usually 64bit games come in same package,With two executable,One for 32bit,one for 64bit.
I'd prefer two separate distributions, with two separate entries in Steam library. Anyone who bought KSP, will get them both. That way it won't mess with mods and saves.
What makes you think it would mess with mods or saves in the first place?

What makes you think it would mess with mods or saves in the first place?

Some mods and plugins may not work correctly with 64-bit (see the corresponding topics) until (and if ever) they're updated, but will work flawlessly with 32-bit, and vice versa. So it's better to have two installations.
They'll almost certainly release the update with two executables in the same package. KSP.exe and KSP_x64.exe, or something similar.
For the Linux version on Steam there are simply two executables in the game directory (we already have 64-bit version).

I'd prefer two separate distributions, with two separate entries in Steam library. Anyone who bought KSP, will get them both. That way it won't mess with mods and saves.
